title: Working Student in Productmanagement (m/f/d)
description: Who we are:Superlyst Ventures is a seed-stage investor, focussing on founders building the next wave of tech-driven companies. We actively support the teams we invest in strategy, go-to-market and follow-on fundraising - always working beyond limits to turn visions into reality.Our Mission:Our aim is to boost the entrepreneurial ecosystem by allocating Ô¨Ånancial and/or operational resources to founders with a potentially valuable idea or an existing product. We help to launch, build and grow tech-startups from the idea-stage to Series-A.In this case, we are basically recruiting for one of our portfolio companies resp. partners: DMEXCO (the leading digital marketing Business Event in Europe)TasksBecome a member of our small and agile Superlyst team and receive responsibility from day one in designing and achieving the conzept and targets of the largest european digital mearketing event.In a nutshell, you will support the Advisor Agency Scheme of DMEXCO in all relevant business developement and communication tasks. More detail:You‚Äôll support the core team on a daily base from October to september 2022, when the next event cologne will take placeYou‚Äôll support us with co- and further development of our CRM database (Hubspot) and measures such as pushing new Ideas, creating presentations for internal and external publicationsYou will independently own the lead gen funnel via HubspotYou will be given research activities and look for new potential Leads across the digital marketing agency environment every day and keep us up to date on emerging trendsYou‚Äôll be an active part in helping us to improve our day to day businesses and get the chance to implement new ideas and marketing strategiesYou will help to create best written content and social media posts to attract more potential customersYou will help us to develop our automated project management processes and communicationYou‚Äôll also reach out to agencies and evaluate both team and product maturityWith this role you will be able to set the baseline for your path as a longterm business developement and marketing student or internshipRequirementsYou enjoy working on a creative and analytical projectmanagement approachYou are preferably in the third or fourth semester of a university degree in business, marketing or any equivalent fieldYou have a certain talent for creativity and design, as well for data and analyticsIdeally you are familiar with Hubspot CRM and Social Media Content Creating and PostingYou are passionate about technology and innovation and self-motivatedYou are comfortable with a proactive, team-oriented attitude, flexibility and have the ability to work under pressureYou have very good knowledge of the common MS Office tools (Excel, PowerPoint, Word) as well of creative toolsYou are proficient in written and spoken German and EnglishBenefitsIn return, we offer you an exciting long-term employment during your academic studies ‚Äì the estimated working time per week is approx. 20 h / week that will help you to combine your theoretical knowhow with real life practice. Responsibility from day oneA modern office in city center next to the Eisbach Welle (yes we also have boards and wetsuits ;-)) with lots of Caf√©s and cultural spots next doorWorking together with the Founders and Partners of two Venture Capital Funds. And gaining insights on venture business for freeFlat hierarchies and constant knowledge exchangeA working model that supports remote work (hybrid, 2 days office 2 days remote)If you are interested in contributing your commitment to a highly motivated and entrepreneurial team, we would like to get to know you. How to apply?submit your applicaton via our process. In lieu of your application, please respond to the following questions:What is your availability for this role - starting date (ideally from October)Give us a two sentence summary about your academic/professional background. Tell us about a specific accomplishment from your background that explains how you fit with our candidate description above.

title: Business & Administration Working Student (m/f/d)
description: About The JobWe are looking for an extraordinary person that shares our vision of the future of legal & regulatory processes and that have the drive to be part of a group that rethinks how companies work with regulations.We are looking for you as a Business & Administration Working Student (m/f/d) that will work closely with our CEO & CPO and the Team behind. Word, Excel and PowerPoint)Length: Minimum 6 months (with options to extend), 15-20h/weekGood knowledge of spoken and written English (company language is English)Are located in Munich - we will work in hybrid mode but we love to connect in the officeWhy us?The most important thing is you can shape and have an impact on a cloud software product, with a state-of-the-art tech stack and your contribution will have an impact on the company's success.Besides that, we offer:Working in an early-stage start-up with a world-class team and flat hierarchiesSignificant learning opportunity across a broad range of topics with a guaranteed, fast learning curve and sufficient freedomHigh level of responsibility and impact on the companyFair compensation, flexible working schedules, free choice of when you want to work - flextime and hybrid work is standardA comfortable environment: we value leisure time, family and friends, open communication, and feeling comfortable is very important to usA team that is very welcoming to new members, we‚Äôre embracing each other and learn from our mutual experiences, and celebrate togetherStartup feeling in the Werksviertel in Munich at Werk1 (right next to a Ferris wheel!) Free beverages (water, tea, coffee, beer) in our officeClosingNo matter your origin, ethnicity, gender identity, religion, or individual requirements @Certivity all that counts is you as a person! Convince us with your personality and your skills‚ÄØ- and together we will make great things happen.If you‚Äôre interested, drop us your application and a short description of yourself.Show us who you are and what you're proud of!We are looking forward to meeting you!We are not interested in freelancers, headhunters, or other types of agencies.Founded in 2021, we at Certivity are a young, creative, and dynamic team of highly skilled domain experts working on innovative RegTech Software. Our solution will shape and define the term ‚ÄúRegTech‚Äù as we develop a completely new product for the highly complex and not yet digitized environment of product regulations. Our primary focus is the automotive industry, with options to expand to many other domains as well. Our B2B cloud platform bundles all relevant tasks for compliance with vehicle regulations and laws. For more information about us and our product have a look at our website.

title: Working Student Risk Management

Another fundamental value at State Street is active engagement with our communities around the world, both as a partner and a leader. title: Werkstudent (m/w/d)
description: Werkstudent (m/w/d) bei Timberland in M√ºnchen  (18 Std./Woche)  Bewerben Sie sich jetzt und ergreifen Sie die Chance, Teil eines gro√üartigen Teams zu werden und die Verantwortung daf√ºr zu √ºbernehmen, unseren KundInnen ein unvergessliches Einkaufserlebnis zu bieten! Als Verk√§uferIn inspirieren Sie unsere KundInnen, bieten einen herausragenden Kundenservice und sorgen daf√ºr, dass unser Verkaufsraum die h√∂chsten Standards erf√ºllt.  Timberland geh√∂rt zur VF-Familie. Mit unserer Familie von renommierten Marken mit Kultfaktor verbindet das internationale Bekleidungsunternehmen VF Menschen mit den Lifestyles, Aktivit√§ten und Erlebnissen, die sie lieben. Im Zentrum unserer Arbeit liegt unser Ziel: We power movements of sustainable and active lifestyles for the betterment of people and our planet. Das ist unser Ziel. Deshalb kommen wir jeden Tag zur Arbeit. Es vereint uns und motiviert uns, unsere Pl√§ne gemeinsam zu verfolgen. Das ist unsere Berufung. Seit Jahrzehnten orientieren wir uns an einem h√∂heren Ziel: Die Welt so zu inspirieren und auszustatten, dass sie zusammenkommt, zusammenarbeitet und nach Verbesserung strebt.  √úber die Position   Unsere Verk√§uferInnen haben bei uns die gro√üartige Gelegenheit, ihr volles Potenzial zu entfalten. Denn bei uns unterst√ºtzen Sie ein internationales Unternehmen und werden darin bekr√§ftigt, auf Filialebene Verantwortung zu √ºbernehmen.   Sie machen den Unterschied   Von unseren Verk√§uferInnen erwarten wir, dass sie ein unvergessliches Einkaufserlebnis bieten, indem sie:  Erstklassigen Kundenservice liefern und dadurch den respektvollen Umgang mit allen KundInnen sicherstellenGenauestens √ºber die in der Filiale angebotenen Produkte Bescheid wissenMerchandising-Standards gem√§√ü den Markenrichtlinien aufrechterhaltenStets im Bilde √ºber die neuesten Trends und die aktuelle Positionierung der Marke innerhalb des Marktes sindAlle betrieblichen Abl√§ufe in der Filiale und im Lagerraum einhalten. Was macht Sie zum/zur perfekten Verk√§uferIn?   Sie lieben den direkten Kundenkontakt. Mit Ihrer praxisorientierten Mentalit√§t, Ihrem Enthusiasmus und Ihrer Leidenschaft f√ºr das Schaffen eines fantastischen Kundenerlebnisses gehen Sie mit gutem Beispiel f√ºr den Rest des Teams voran. Sie haben eine positive, proaktive Einstellung und nehmen sich jeder Situation in der Filiale anSie haben eine Leidenschaft f√ºr unsere Marke, Mode und Einzelhandel im AllgemeinenSie besitzen hervorragende schriftliche und m√ºndliche Kommunikationsf√§higkeiten in Deutsch und Englisch Sie sind flexibel und w√ºrden bei Bedarf auch an Wochenenden, Feiertagen und in den Abendstunden arbeitenErfahrung ist gro√üartig, aber nicht erforderlich. Wir legen Wert darauf, dass Sie unsere Leits√§tze leben und demonstrieren: Leben Sie pflichtbewusst, handeln Sie mutig und empathisch, seien Sie neugierig und bleiben Sie standhaft.  Das erwartet Sie  Wir bieten umfassende Leistungen, die das geistige, k√∂rperliche und finanzielle Wohlbefinden aller VF-MitarbeiterInnen f√∂rdern. Bei uns erhalten Sie das volle Leistungspaket.   Die meisten Unternehmen werben mit konkurrenzf√§higem Gehalt, einem fantastischem Bonus, Altersvorsorge und Mitarbeiterrabatten (√ºbrigens: bei uns gibt es 50 %!). All das bieten wir auch. Nur anders. Neben all dem bieten wir Ihnen: Karriereverantwortung, die es Ihnen erm√∂glicht, Ihr Wissen und Ihre Erfahrung √ºber verschiedene Marken hinweg aufzubauen Eine unterst√ºtzende, auf Feedback basierende Arbeitskultur, in der Respekt und Integrit√§t unsere Wegweiser sind Ma√ügeschneidertes Training. Von der Einarbeitung bis hin zu laufenden Trainings online und in Pr√§senz sind wir bestrebt, Sie bei Ihrer beruflichen sowie pers√∂nlichen Entwicklung so gut es geht zu unterst√ºtzen Freie Entfaltung  Unser Bestreben ist es, eine Kultur der Zugeh√∂rigkeit zu f√∂rdern, die auf Respekt, Verbundenheit, Offenheit und Authentizit√§t basiert. Wir haben uns dem Aufbau und Erhalt eines Arbeitsplatzes verschrieben, der die Vielfalt unserer MitarbeiterInnen zelebriert, damit sie w√§hrend ihrer Arbeit ganz sie selbst sein k√∂nnen.   VF ist ein Arbeitgeber, der sich f√ºr Chancengleichheit, die F√∂rderung und die Unterst√ºtzung benachteiligter Gruppen engagiert, indem er gleiche Chancen sowohl f√ºr VF-MitarbeiterInnen als auch f√ºr BewerberInnen schafft. title: Automotive Product Mangement Intern
description: Become part of the 4. screen team4.screen is the world‚Äôs first platform designed to connect, interact, and engage with drivers. We have developed a fully standardized interface for real-time location-based interaction with every driver, of every car brand, worldwide. We are live with leading car brands and working with the most recognized brands on enabling the future of mobility! As a part of our Mobility & Automotive Integration Team, you will play an integral role in establishing partnerships with leading automotive brands in the industry as well as other mobility service providers. As an Automotive Product Management Intern are considered a full part of our team, making critical decisions that will not only have an impact on your team, but the overall achievement of our company vision. You‚Äôll get to work closely with your mentor and team members while taking ownership of initiatives independently. We are driven by the passion to recognize aspiring talents and are therefore committed to helping you grow both professionally and personally. Your roleDefine our products and shape our use cases: You will contribute to our long-term success and growth by building up our product portfolio with a focus on our automotive partners including the complete lifecycle managementEnable strategic decisions by means of in-depth market analysis: You support our Mobility & Automotive Integration Team by addressing important questions for data-driven decisions around all activities and the project/product management in close cooperation with our automotive partnerCreate customer-oriented presentations of our product: You prepare and contribute presentations and pitches that explain products or srvices to existing and prospective customers, thus supporting all sales, marketing, and partnership activities with automakers and mobility service-providersCapture and communicate customer requirements to our Tech Team: You identify forward-looking as well as sought-after features on the market and help to integrate them into our development pipeline in cooperation with our software expertsEngineer and establish internal processes and tools for 4.screen and the Mobility & Automotive Integration Team: You get the opportunity to shape our company and teamwork mode by proactively bringing up and implementing new ideas and best practices to optimize the efficiency in our internal processesOur RequirementsCurrent enrollment in a master‚Äôs program or nearing completion of a bachelor‚Äôs degree, ideally in the field of Business Administration with a focus on Entrepreneurship, Strategy, Marketing (or similar) or Business Engineering, Business InformaticsAvailability for at 3-6 Months internship (follow-up employment as a Working Student or Full-Time is possible)Proficiency in English (min. B2+), German is a plusPrevious internship or working student experience (ideally in consulting, tech, automotive industry, or similar)Ability to work independently and take ownershipHands-On and Can-Do mindsetCuriosity to learn, dive deep into new topics, and support putting insights into actionStrong team player, who is happy sharing knowledge with othersWhy you should join usImpact: As a full member of the team from day 1, you get the opportunity to personally shape our big vision and drive your own projectsFeedback & Exchange: Starting with your onboarding buddy, you will work alongside leading experts get their feedback and benefit from their experiencesWork-life-balance: Enjoy regular days off, recharge yourself and make memories outside of workFlexibility: We provide a hybrid working environment with an office right next to the Olympic StadiumCompensation package: We offer paid internships and a competitive salary for our working studentsTop equipment: We provide you with high-quality gadgets you need to perform at your absolute bestPotential: We would love to keep you for the long run! Depending on our possibilities we could see you transitioning into a full-time position with us at 4.screen after your studiesCommunity: We celebrate our teams and achievements with regular (virtual) after-work drinks or events such as going to the OktoberfestWe stand for equal opportunity for everyone and value diversity. Therefore, we encourage an open and inclusive working environment where you can be exactly who you are. We truly believe that individual strengths and personalities make a great contribution to our success story. Hence, even if you don‚Äôt fulfill all of the points above but believe that you are still a great addition to our team and 4.screen a place you‚Äôd love to work at, we can only encourage you to apply!About 4.screen4.screen is the world‚Äôs first platform designed to connect, interact, and engage with drivers. 4.screen‚Äôs Mobility Experience Cloud (MXC) provides a fully standardized interface for real-time location-based interaction with every driver, of every car brand, worldwide. Car brands, navigation systems, and mobility service providers integrate 4.screen APIs into their systems to enable billions of interactions every day. Drivers benefit from a wide variety of useful services such as relevant in-car recommendations, better in-car content, and access to exclusive offers. Businesses of all sizes - from local shops to global brands and smart cities - are using 4.screen technology to increase the visibility of their brand or location by offering useful content to drivers. 4.screen is headquartered in Munich and has the world‚Äôs leading brands as customers. Our team at 4.screen consists of ambitious team players that think big and don‚Äôt limit themselves. With a mix of young talents and industry experts that have previously been in leading positions at BMW, Daimler, or Google, we continue building an innovative company where everything is dynamic, disruptive, and exciting - and that you can be part of! Are you ready to join the ride and shape the future of mobility?____

title: Product & Marketing Manager ‚Äì Digital O.R.
description: Founded in Munich, Germany in 1989, Brainlab develops, manufactures and markets software-driven medical technology, enabling access to improved, more efficient, less-invasive patient treatments. Our key to success is our creative, talented and hard-working team, which consists of around 2000 dedicated and inspiring individuals in 25 locations worldwide. To succeed in reaching our targets, we are seeking committed colleagues who can stand behind our core values curious, authentic and useful:Job DescriptionProduct Management and Marketing is the voice of the customer inside Brainlab and the voice of Brainlab to the customer. We are responsible for evolving our customer experience and for driving product commercialization by specifying, launching and maturing products.As a Product & Marketing Manager Digital O.R., you will have global ownership and responsibility for multiple Brainlab Digital O.R. products which comprise generic hardware and software components. Built as an open, modular platform, Brainlab integrated Digital O.R. gathers, manages and displays the right data in all setups, whether simple or complex, from straightforward general surgery to high-end hybrid O.R.s. The O.R. of the future is as much about data augmentation and information integration as it is about high-tech medical devices. At Brainlab, our mission is to streamline device and information usage and enrich clinical data before, during and after surgery.You will be responsible for the respective global business results and collaborate with multiple internal functions including Marketing Communications, PR, R&D and international sales. Furthermore, you will drive the overarching outward facing product marketing and augment a team of product managers with your marketing-focused skills and knowledge.This role requires someone who is highly skilled from both a business and marketing perspective, with strong analytical skills, a solid technical understanding and the ability to influence at all levels in the organization. You also need to be able to collaborate in multi-disciplinary teams.Your Responsibilities / TasksGain a deep understanding of customer experience and identify their needsCreate and maintain a product and supervise on partner management and business developmentProduct core data: develop basic product briefing including unmet needs, target groups, positioning, features and benefits, unique selling propositions, pricing and bundlingEstablish relationships with key opinion leaders and spend time with customers and sales in the field / at tradeshowsField visits: spend at least one week/quarter in the field together with SalesDevelop value proposition, messaging and claimsDevelop and present training material for Sales, distributors and partner companies that are suited to / account for differences in marketsAdministrate articles, product bundles, pricing for assigned productTraining: develop training material in cooperation with Marketing Communications and support product training for Sales, distributors and partner companies, organized by Regional Marketing managementSupport customer visits at headquarters with presentations and in-depth product demosQualificationsThe ideal candidate will have a proven technical and product-focused track record or professional experience of 3 or more years in the O.R. environment, as well as:University degree in business administration experienceStrong presentation and communications skills together with solid project management and stakeholder management ability (collaborate with others in a dynamic organization / matrix environment)An analytical, decisive, and committed personality with an outgoing nature and strong interpersonal skillsKnowledge of CRM (salesforce.com) and Business Intelligence ToolsExperience in lean project management is a plusAbility to work effectively both alone and with limited supervision or as part of a collaborative team of diverse individualsAbility to work at a consistently high standard while maintaining attention to detail and delivering against demanding timelinesBusiness fluency in written and spoken EnglishWillingness to travel up to 30% of the time; the position is You could be working with an ex-scuba instructor and master bakers on one day and an ex-professional basketball player and a rave enthusiast on another. If there is something different about you, you will fit right in.The Role:We are looking for a skilled Bicycle Mechanic to assemble, maintain and repair our fleet of e-bikes. You will be responsible for ensuring functionality of Zoomo e-bikes. A Zoomo mechanic must have good manual dexterity and great attention to detail. You must be able to work in a team with various equipment and tools as well as follow all safety precautions. Munich is our newest location, therefore we are looking for a motivated and self driven mechanic to help us set-up the best e-bike service possible.ResponsibilitiesAssemble and inspect new Zoomo Bikes before adding them to the fleet. Inspect Zoomo bikes and run diagnostics to discover any functionality issues. You are the first contact person for the customer assigned to you and you are enjoying daily customer contact. Repairing and servicing of the e-bikes to the highest level of quality. Perform scheduled e-bike maintenance onsite and offsite. Keep logs of work and report on any issuesEnsure that your work area is safe, clean & tidy. RequirementsProfessional or personal experience with bicycles including motorbikes, e-mopeds or even carsStudent at a German universityFirst experience in customer service or customer facing roles Ideally first experience with e-bikes and lithium ion batteriesAptitude in using various hand tools (screwdrivers, hammers etc.) and precision measurement tools (e.g. calipers)Ability to work independently, but also must be able to work together with global teams. A strong commitment to all health and safety guidelinesFlexibility is an absolute must, we are a startup and things change daily so we hope you will remain flexible outside of your responsibilities to work other days or at a different location in your proximity. Knowledge of English or/and German required. A Driving licence class B is desirable but not essential. A passion for bicycles!BenefitsAt Zoomo, we celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment and equal opportunities. We offer you the chance to be part of an organisation in hyper-growth mode that offers many opportunities for personal development, such as14‚Ç¨ - 15‚Ç¨ per hour depending on experienceFlexible working hours and daysFree e-bike depending on availability. Global fun with a team from the UK, Australia, USA, Philippines, France and more.. Work in a well-funded start-up with a strong leadership team and global presence. The chance to be part of an organisation in hyper-growth with plenty of opportunities for personal development. The full support of an experienced management team in achieving your professional goals. Zoomo is an equal opportunities employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

title: MBSE METHOD CONTRIBUTOR CONSULTANT (M/F/D)
description: Welcome to our sector transport industry. Around 800 colleagues worldwide bring automated, networked and future-oriented innovations onto rail for our renowned customers: from train design to IoT solutions, train control systems to digitalisation and extensive infrastructure project engineering. Are you the one to bring excellence onto RAIL?This Is What We OfferExciting mix of cross-industry experience, high learning effects and varied fields of activity from the world of high-tech engineering for the most renowned OEM customers and/or suppliers of powerful industriesEnthusiasm and passion for engineering and research & development with a great deal of creative freedom, so that today's demanding challenges can become tomorrow's innovative solutionsBalance of work and family life through centrally located, modern offices with good connectionsGood work-life balance, flexible working hours, 30 days' holiday and home or mobile working by arrangementPeople-friendly, varied working environment, a "first name" culture from CEO to working student and numerous opportunities to celebrate successes even across different locations (e.g. team events, summer party and kick-off events)THIS IS THE JOBYou will contribute to the development of engineering processes and methodology for architectural design following an MBSE approachYou will participate in the development of the engineering process, methodology and test tools for requirements management following an MBSE approach You will support the development team (DBS + European initiatives) in terms of processes and methodologyYou will report any obstacles in the methodology to the team and improve the current contentYou will support the development of templates for deliverablesYou will work in the Systems Engineering expert team that guides other teams with systems engineering, modelling and requirements expertiseYou will help to improve the methods and guidance of the Model-Based Systems Engineering (MBSE) approach to satisfy the stakeholder needsYou will work on methods on how to capture requirements in the MBSE model (beyond textural requirements) to enable the generation of specification documents directly from the modelYou will drive the creation of concepts, presentations and overviewsYou have the opportunity to contribute and implement your own ideas in our flexible environmentThis Is What We Need Bachelor's degree in systems engineering At least 5 years of relevant professional experience Experience in the rail sector is an advantageSE / MBSE: having good knowledge on SE concepts and on the modern MBSE techniques and how to apply them is crucial. Knowledge on ISO 15288 is a plusSysML: knowing the language and having a strong experience into systems modelling is crucialSystems Architecting: having a strong experience in systems architecting techniques (trade-off analysis, ...) and architecture framework is crucial. Good knowledge of ISO 42010 is a plusKnowledge of Capella/ARCADIA is a plusFluent in EnglishDeep understanding of model-based systems engineering principles and practices, including:Process modellingRequiremts engineeringArchitectural frameworksVariant and product line modelsFully conversant with SysML notationSound knowledge of ISO 15288 (Required)Knowledge of architecture, trade-off analysis and special topics such as RAMS - CESAM (level 1) certification an advantageWE LOOK FORWARD TO MEETING YOUDo you have any questions about the job profile and/or requirements?Please get in touch with your contact person in Recruiting.Capgemini EngineeringAltran Deutschland S.A.S. & Co.KGJule D√ºsterh√∂ft+49 160 9327 9372jule-charlott.duesterhoeft@capgemini.comwww.capgemini-engineering.comPlease fill in our online application form completely and attach your CV, work and school certificates as well as any other relevant documents. We wish you every success for your application

title: Internship Solutions Architecture - Amazon Web Services
description: Job SummaryDESCRIPTIONAre you passionate about collaborating with technology and business leaders to deliver cloud-based solutions?Amazon Web Services (AWS) is a place where builders can build. Our internships offer exceptional opportunities for you to grow your technical and non-technical skills. From day one, you will be working with experienced engineers who love what they do.Are you ready to embrace the challenge? Come build the future with us.Associate Solutions Architect InternThe Solutions Architects (SA) organization is a diverse team that focuses on helping customers build infrastructures and applications at scale using AWS solutions. Our solutions architects are passionate technologists with technical breadth and depth coupled with strong interpersonal skills.As an SA intern, you will receive AWS technical training, immerse yourself in cloud computing, develop business acumen, presentation delivery, and learn more about Amazon culture. You will work in a one on one project environment with the possibility of group projects, complete the AWS Cloud Practitioner Certification, and attend professional development events.Upon successful completion of the internship program, selected interns will receive a full-time offer to join as an Associate Solutions Architect (which includes a six-month training program, known as AWS TechU program) in 2023/2024, after completion of their degree program.Amazon internships are full-time (40 hours/week) and normally run for 12 or more consecutive weeks with flexible timelines during 2023.NoteThe internship is offered for our Munich office location.Applications are reviewed on a rolling basis. For an update on your status, or to confirm your application was submitted successfully, please login to your candidate portal. Please note that we are reviewing a high volume of applications and appreciate your patience.About The TeamAbout the teamInclusive Team CultureHere at AWS, it‚Äôs in our nature to learn and be curious about diverse perspectives. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower employees to feel proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.Work/Life HarmonyOur team puts a high value on work-life harmony. It isn‚Äôt about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it‚Äôs about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfilment and we encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives which is why flexible work hours and arrangements are part of our culture.Mentorship & Career GrowthWe have a career path for you no matter what stage you‚Äôre in when you start here. We‚Äôre continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth‚Äôs Best Employer. That‚Äôs why you‚Äôll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.Basic QualificationsCurrently in your penultimate or final year of a degree in Computer Science / Engineering / Mathematics / Technology / Related science/technical field. Ideally completing this degree post-internship.Interest and aptitude to learn about and deliver cloud-based solutions to customers.Experience with one of the programming languages like Java, Python, Ruby, Node.js, C#, or C++.Written and verbal communication skills and ability to effectively articulate technical challenges and solutions to both large and small audiences.Fluent proficiency in English.Preferred Qualifications Demonstrated ability to adapt to new technologies and learn quickly Experience with Networking fundamentals including Security, Storage or Databases (Relational and/or NoSQL), Operating Systems (Unix, Linux, and/or Windows) Experience with software development lifecycle (SDLC) and agile/iterative methodologies; Experience with infrastructure as code, ops automation, and/ or configuration management tools such as Chef, Puppet, or Ansible. Knowledge of the primary AWS services such as EC2, ELB, RDS, VPC, Route53, and/or S3. Experience around implementing cloud-based technology solutions - in a school project or while working for a company. Fluent proficiency in German.Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.m/w/dCompany - AWS EMEA SARL (Germany Branch)Job ID: A2278813
